description.narrative: Social acceptance of practices harmful to children in targeted locations reduced and improved access to services for GBV survivors,which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved access to justice, social services and a minimum package of preventive and protective processes for Somali children, realized through a functional child protection system linked with comprehensive community based child protection mechanisms

title.narrative: Social acceptance of practices harmful to children in targeted locations reduced and improved access to services for GBV survivors

description.narrative: UNICEF scaled-up prevention and response services to respond to Gender-Based Violence (GBV) during the drought period that was declared in Somalia from March-2017 and extended till first quarter of 2018. Reporting on GBV including access-to-services for survivors, continues to be hampered by stigma associated with GBV violations in Somalia. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017
